name: Recipe - Food - Nutrition
description:
The spoonacular Nutrition, Recipe, and Food API allows you to access over 365,000 recipes and 86,000 food products. Our food ontology and semantic recipe search engine makes it possible to search for recipes using natural language queries, such as "gluten free brownies without sugar" or "low fat vegan cupcakes." You can automatically calculate the nutritional information for any recipe, analyze recipe costs, visualize ingredient lists, find recipes for what's in your fridge, find recipes based on special diets, nutritional requirements, or favorite ingredients, classify recipes into types and cuisines, convert ingredient amounts, or even compute an entire meal plan. With our powerful API, you can create many kinds of food and especially nutrition apps.

Special diets/dietary requirements currently available include: vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, gluten free, grain free, dairy free, high protein, low sodium, low carb, Paleo, Primal, ketogenic, FODMAP, and Whole 30. We will soon be adding Weight Watcher points, too.

api_methods.name: Create Recipe Card (Deprecated)
api_methods.description: Create a recipe card given a recipe.

parameters.name: backgroundImage
parameters.description: The background image ("none","background1", or "background2").

parameters.name: readyInMinutes
parameters.description: The number of minutes it takes to get the recipe on the table.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the recipe.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The binary image of the recipe as jpg.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: The mask to put over the recipe image ("ellipseMask", "diamondMask", "diamondMask", "starMask", "heartMask", "potMask", "fishMask").

parameters.name: instructions
parameters.description: The instructions to make the recipe. One step per line.

parameters.name: ingredients
parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

parameters.name: servings
parameters.description: The number of servings that you can make from the ingredients.

parameters.name: fontColor
parameters.description: The font color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source of the recipe.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: The author of the recipe.

parameters.name: backgroundColor
parameters.description: The background color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

utterances.utterance: Create a recipe card for a 30-minute chicken curry with rice, using background2, a star mask, and serving 4 people.

parameters.title: Chicken Curry with Rice
parameters.instructions: Cook the chicken. Add curry sauce. Serve with rice.
parameters.ingredients:
1 lb chicken
2 cups rice
1 cup curry sauce

utterances.utterance: Make a recipe card for a 45-minute vegetarian lasagna, using background1, a heart mask, and serving 6 people.

parameters.title: Vegetarian Lasagna
parameters.instructions: Layer pasta, sauce, and cheese. Bake for 30 minutes.
parameters.ingredients:
1 lb pasta
2 cups tomato sauce
1 cup cheese

parameters.title: Avocado Toast
parameters.instructions: Toast bread. Mash avocado. Spread on toast.
parameters.ingredients:
2 slices bread
1 avocado
Salt and pepper

6 cups broth

parameters.title: Fruit Salad
parameters.instructions: Chop fruits. Mix together. Serve chilled.

parameters.ingredients:

parameters.title: Chicken Noodle Soup
parameters.instructions: Boil chicken. Add noodles and vegetables. Simmer for 30 minutes.

api_methods.name: Recipe Nutrition Widget
api_methods.description:
Visualize a recipe's nutritional information as HTML including CSS. 

Full example code of how to work with widgets can be found in our [spoonacular-widget GitHub](https://github.com/ddsky/spoonacular-widgets).

parameters.name: servings
parameters.description: The number of servings.

parameters.name: ingredientList
parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

parameters.name: showBacklink
parameters.description: Whether to show a backlink to spoonacular.

parameters.name: defaultCss
parameters.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The input language, either "en" or "de".

api_methods.name: Detect Food in Text
api_methods.description: Detect ingredients and dishes in texts.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text in which food items such as dish names and ingredients should be detected in.
parameters.default: I like to eat delicious tacos. Only cheeseburger with cheddar are better than that. But then again, pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms, and tomatoes is so good!

utterances.utterance: Can you detect the food items in this text: 'For dinner, I had a grilled chicken salad with avocado and a side of garlic bread.'

parameters.text: For dinner, I had a grilled chicken salad with avocado and a side of garlic bread.

utterances.utterance: Identify the ingredients and dishes in this sentence: 'She made a delicious lasagna with ricotta cheese, spinach, and marinara sauce.'

parameters.text: She made a delicious lasagna with ricotta cheese, spinach, and marinara sauce.

utterances.utterance: What food items are mentioned here: 'I love starting my day with a smoothie made of bananas, strawberries, and almond milk.'

parameters.text: I love starting my day with a smoothie made of bananas, strawberries, and almond milk.

utterances.utterance: Detect the dishes and ingredients in this text: 'He prepared a hearty beef stew with carrots, potatoes, and onions.'

parameters.text: He prepared a hearty beef stew with carrots, potatoes, and onions.

utterances.utterance: Find the food items in this sentence: 'We enjoyed a vegetarian pizza topped with bell peppers, olives, and mushrooms.'

parameters.text: We enjoyed a vegetarian pizza topped with bell peppers, olives, and mushrooms.

utterances.utterance: What are the food items in this text: 'For dessert, we had a chocolate cake with raspberry filling and whipped cream.'

parameters.text: For dessert, we had a chocolate cake with raspberry filling and whipped cream.

utterances.utterance: Identify the ingredients and dishes in this sentence: 'She baked a batch of oatmeal cookies with raisins and walnuts.'

parameters.text: She baked a batch of oatmeal cookies with raisins and walnuts.

utterances.utterance: Detect the food items in this text: 'He made a spicy curry with chicken, coconut milk, and a blend of Indian spices.'

parameters.text: He made a spicy curry with chicken, coconut milk, and a blend of Indian spices.

utterances.utterance: What dishes and ingredients are mentioned here: 'We had a refreshing fruit salad with watermelon, cantaloupe, and honeydew.'

parameters.text: We had a refreshing fruit salad with watermelon, cantaloupe, and honeydew.

utterances.utterance: Find the food items in this sentence: 'For lunch, I had a turkey sandwich with lettuce, tomato, and mustard.'

parameters.text: For lunch, I had a turkey sandwich with lettuce, tomato, and mustard.

api_methods.name: Analyze Recipe
api_methods.description: This endpoint allows you to send raw recipe information, such as title, servings, and ingredients, to then see what we compute (badges, diets, nutrition, and more). This is useful if you have your own recipe data and want to enrich it with our semantic analysis.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The input language, either \\\"en\\\" or \\\"de\\\".

utterances.utterance: Analyze this recipe for a vegan chocolate cake, including taste and nutrition details.

Analyze this recipe for a vegetarian lasagna, including nutritional details.

Analyze this recipe for a low-sodium soup, focusing on nutrition.
Analyze this recipe for a whole 30 compliant breakfast bowl, including taste and nutrition.

api_methods.name: Connect User
api_methods.description:
In order to call user-specific endpoints, you need to connect your app's users to spoonacular users.

Just call this endpoint with your user's information and you will get back a username and hash that you must save on your side. In future requests that you make on this user's behalf you simply pass their username and hash alongside your API key.

utterances.utterance: Connect my user to the spoonacular API to access personalized recipes.
Register my app's user with spoonacular to get a username and hash.
Link my user account to spoonacular for personalized nutrition and recipe access.
Set up a connection for my user to spoonacular to enable user-specific API calls.
Create a spoonacular user profile for my app's user to access dietary-specific recipes.
Connect my user to spoonacular to allow them to search for recipes based on their dietary needs.
Register my user with spoonacular to enable access to nutritional information for recipes.
Link my app's user to spoonacular to allow them to find recipes based on ingredients they have.
Connect my user to spoonacular to enable them to calculate meal plans and nutritional data.
Set up a spoonacular user account for my app's user to access recipe and food product data.
